document_title: Streptococcal arthritis: Causes, signs, treatment and prevention
subsection_name: viem-khop-lien-cau.json_3_4. Signs and symptoms of the disease
subsection_content:
Patients with streptococcal arthritis will have symptoms such as: (4)
Symptoms in joints: Patients often have pain in infected joints, especially hip joints, knee joints, shoulder joints, wrist joints, elbow joints... Accompanying symptoms are inflammation, swelling, heat, and some redness. In cases where pus may leak. Inflamed joints often have severe, continuous pain, which increases with movement; Whole body symptoms: Patients often have high fever of about 39째C - 40째C, chills, weight loss, fatigue, dirty tongue, dry skin...; Extra-articular symptoms: Swollen lymph nodes at the corresponding inflammation site, some signs of initial infection may appear.
